creditline: The James S. Bell Memorial Fund, by exchange
description: Tankard, Charles II, slightly tapering cylindrical body, engraved with contemporary armorials within a plume cartouche; cap-shaped cover; bifurcated thumbpiece and simple scroll handle, on moulded base.
inscription:
Marks

-On the front are engraved the coat of arms and crest of Broome (Herefordshire), granted in 1670, within a foliate scroll and tasseled mantling.
markings:
Mark

-Fully marked on side near handle.  Fully marked on upper sie of cover.  Maker\'s mark on handle.

maker\'s mark: [F.S.], mullet below; marks on handle, body and cover; engraved coat-of-arms, crest and helmet of Broome
Marked on body, handle and cover.
title: Tankard
